ca.mcgill.ecse211.capturetheflag

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.capturetheflag.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Odometer can spawn a thread to keep track of wheel rotation to have a good estimate of the position of the center of rotation of the robot.
    Author:
    Michael Vaquier, Oliver Clark

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructs an Odometer object.

      Stops the odometer no matter its mode
      void timedOut()
      This method is the interrupt service routine which is processed every period that the odometer is refreshed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        public Odometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                double wheelRadius,
                double track)
        Constructs an Odometer object.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - Reference to the left motor
        rightMotor - Reference to the right motor
        wheelRadius - Radius of the wheels
        track - Width of the wheelbase

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the odometer, to periodically poll the tachocount of the wheels to update the current position of the robot.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • timedOut

        public void timedOut()
        This method is the interrupt service routine which is processed every period that the odometer is refreshed.

      • getPosition

        public void getPosition(double[] position,
                        boolean[] update)
        Writes the current position of the robot in the input array only at the positions where an update is requested. The indices of the array corresponds to the positions as such: 0: x 1: y 2: T
        Parameters:
        position - Array to be written to
        update - Array indicating which indices to write to

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double[] position,
                        boolean[] update)
        Writes the current positions from the input array to the robot's odometer where an update is requested. The indices of the array corresponds to the positions as such: 0: x 1: y 2: T
        Parameters:
        position - The array to read from
        update - Array indicating which indices to read from
